property.name: hive.exec.stagingdir
property.description: Directory name that will be created inside table locations in order to support HDFS encryption. This is replaces ${hive.exec.scratchdir} for query results with the exception of read-only tables. In all cases ${hive.exec.scratchdir} is still used for other temporary files, such as job plans.

property.name: hive.exec.scratchdir
property.description: HDFS root scratch dir for Hive jobs which gets created with write all (733) permission. For each connecting user, an HDFS scratch dir: ${hive.exec.scratchdir}/<username> is created, with ${hive.scratch.dir.permission}.

property.name: hive.query.results.cache.max.size
property.description: Maximum total size in bytes that the query results cache directory is allowed to use on the filesystem.

property.name: hive.query.results.cache.max.entry.size
property.description: Maximum size in bytes that a single query result is allowed to use in the results cache directory

property.name: hive.notification.event.poll.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. How often the notification log is polled for new NotificationEvents from the metastore.A nonpositive value means the notification log is never polled.

property.name: hive.blobstore.supported.schemes
property.description: Comma-separated list of supported blobstore schemes.

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL
property.description: JDBC connect string for a JDBC metastore

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionUserName
property.description: username to use against metastore database
